alert.note: Alert for Natrona County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 3:19PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Natrona County through 400 PM MDT... At 317 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southeast of Red Wall, or 31 miles south of Kaycee, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, half inch hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Natrona County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
